For example, your HRV reading is 50 but this app will read it as 25. This app needs to use the HRV number provided by the watch. It should not be dividing the actual HRV by 50%. 
This app has had plenty of time during beta testing to squash this bug. There have been plenty of updates to address this issue.
I do expect this app to be updated to read correctly. The next step is getting this app permanently removed from the App Store.
Attention DEVs: an Apple Watch can successfully take a HRV measurement. Program your app to take that number as it is . It‚Äôs that simple.

{'id': 27228470, 'body': "Hi, thank you for the feedback. I'll be glad to clarify your concerns.

HRV can be computed in many different ways. The most widely used HRV metrics are SDNN and rMSSD. Based on many pieces of research, and common practice in the science community and according to our own experience, the HRV rMSSD is considered the most widely used and reliable for short-term measurements of nervous system response. 

For this reason, our app calculates your HRV using rMSSD. 
The HRV in Apple Health is SDNN HRV. This is why you see the different numbers. Unfortunately, in both cases, the results are named just HRV. And it may cause confusion.

Please, feel free to contact us at dev@activeace.app if you have any other questions about the app or something left unclear. I‚Äôll be very happy to clarify this to make sure you get the best value from using the app.

review:
Complete waste of money! I just recently got an Apple Watch and I missed having the stress feature I had on other watches. I thought this app would work like that and update regularly and give me insight to my stress. I went ahead and paid $20 for one month subscription. $20 is A LOT of money for an app per month. I regretted the decision 3 days later when I realized this app was pretty worthless. They‚Äôre completely overcharging to tell you information you can find in apple health.

This is the information it tells you and where you can find it. Average HRV (apple health), Resting heart rate and heart rate (Apple health or your watch), your activity goals (same ones in Apple Fitness), how long you slept and your 14 day sleep quality (Apple Health) I also use the app Pillow for sleep tracking. 

Also the HRV from apple health and this app aren‚Äôt the same because this app uses some special calculation that gives you a different number. It‚Äôs stupid and makes no sense.

It said I could use the ECG on my watch to take measurements. For like a week straight I took like 5-7 ECGs a day to see how my score fluctuated and it didn‚Äôt. 

The only thing you can‚Äôt find anywhere else is the body feedback score. My score hardly changed in 3 weeks. Every day the apps ‚Äúrecommendation‚Äù tells me one of the three alternating messages . Either I‚Äôm not sleeping well and prioritize sleep and go to bed earlier or that my body is stressed and still needs time to recovery and to take it easy.

Sure I have moments of stress but I know I also have moments of calm and I wanted an app that gave me a real time score continuously throughout the day. I want to know my percentage of stress and calm throughout the day. This app doesn‚Äôt do that. It seems to just do an average score over a period of time. Even then the body feedback score is finicky and often the number is blank and there‚Äôs no data. Even after taking EKGs. 

This app is a huge waste of money. It doesn‚Äôt do anything, or tell you anything different. It takes a lot effort on your end either using the mindfulness app or EKGs (which don‚Äôt update right away and can take a while) to make this app update and run. There‚Äôs a much better app out there Welltory and the free version tells you more than this.
